member.name: T:ViDi.NET.Interfaces.WorkspaceAccessLevel
member.summary: Defines the different levels of authority required to call various workspace-maniuplating methods.

member.name: F:ViDi.NET.Interfaces.WorkspaceAccessLevel.Anyone
member.summary: No authorization is required to access the workspace being requested.

member.name: F:ViDi.NET.Interfaces.WorkspaceAccessLevel.Read
member.summary: The caller must have permission to view the workspace being requested.

member.name: F:ViDi.NET.Interfaces.WorkspaceAccessLevel.Write
member.summary: The caller must have permission to modify the workspace being manipulated.

member.name: F:ViDi.NET.Interfaces.WorkspaceAccessLevel.Owner
member.summary: The caller must be the user that created the workspace being manipulated.

member.name: T:ViDi.NET.Interfaces.AuthorizeWorkspaceAccessAttribute
member.summary:
Defines a parameter that should be applied to LibraryAccess methods that take private data (e.g. existing workspaces) as arguments and access/modify those data.
In a multi-user remote scenario, a request handler should consume this attribute to see what level of authorization is required to call the method.

member.name: P:ViDi.NET.Interfaces.AuthorizeWorkspaceAccessAttribute.MinimumRequiredAccess
member.summary: The minimum permissions required for the method to operate on its workspace parameter(s). If the operation doesn't infringe on the workspace's privacy, then use to allow any user to call the method.

member.name: T:ViDi.NET.Interfaces.NoAuthorizationRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Defines a parameter that should be applied to LibraryAccess methods that do not take private workspaces as parameters.
member.remarks: This includes methods that don't operate on workspaces, methods that create workspaces (as the workspace doesn't exist yet), and methods that always return results appropriate for the caller (e.g. ListWorkspaces returning only the caller's workspaces).

member.name: T:ViDi.NET.Interfaces.NoOneAuthorizedAttribute
member.summary: Defines a parameter that should be applied to LibraryAccess methods that do shouldn't be executable on the cloud.

member.name: M:ViDi2.IControl.InitializeComputeDevices(System.Enum,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Offers the possibility to initialize the compute devices when the control is created, without unloading the vidi dll example: mode = "GpuMode.SingleDevicePerTool, GpuMode.MultipleDevicesPerTool(No longer supported)" mode = "GpuMode.NoSupport" will deinitilialize all cuda devices This can only be called when all workspaces (runtime or training) are closed.

member.name: M:ViDi2.IControl.StabilizeComputeDevices(System.Enum,System.String)
member.summary: Offers the possibility to stabilize the compute devices when the control is created, without unloading the vidi dll example: mode = "StabilizeMode.Default" mode = "StabilizeMode.Off" mode = "StabilizeMode.On" mode = "StabilizeMode.Extended" mode = "StabilizeMode.Arguments, (not supported yet)" This can only be called after compute devices initialized.

member.name: M:ViDi2.ILibraryAccess.GetWorkspaceDisplayName(ViDi2.WorkspaceName,ViDi2.ILibraryAccessContext)
member.summary: Returns the human-readable display name describing the workspace.
member.remarks:
Depending on the LibraryAccess implementation this may or may not differ from the WorkspaceName that should be passed to other LibraryAccess methods.
In some environments (e.g. cloud), that WorkspaceName may be a unique ID that is meaningless to humans; whereas this method could return a name more suitable for display in a GUI, for example.
member.param: The workspace whose display name should be retrieved.
member.returns: The human-readable display name describing the workspace.

member.name: T:ViDi2.BorderType
member.summary:
Specifies the border modes
Specifies a way to sample outside pixels of image.

member.name: T:ViDi2.MaskingMode
member.summary:
Specifies the masking modes
Specifies a way to apply a mask on sampled image. The mask is used to hide some portions of an image and to reveal some portions.

member.name: T:ViDi2.FlippingMode
member.summary:
Specifies the perturbation flipping modes
Specifies a way to flip the images randomly during sampling.

member.name: P:ViDi2.IToolParameters.SamplingDensity
member.summary:
Gets or sets the sampling density used for processing
The smaller the number, the fewer samples will be taken of the image.
(Between 0.2 and 10)

member.name: P:ViDi2.IToolParameters.FeatureSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the features size of the tool
The tool will actually see an area five times larger than the Feature Size setting.
However, the level of detail will be much higher in the center of the feature, as opposed to the periphery.
(Between 5 and 100,000)

member.name: P:ViDi2.IToolParameters.ColorChannels
member.summary:
Gets the number of color channels
Specifies the number of color channels to use when sampling the image.
1 : Treats the image as greyscale
2 : Channels images (gray+alpha or B+G)
3 : BGR image.
4 : BGRA image

member.name: P:ViDi2.IToolParameters.ChannelFormat
member.summary:
Gets the channel format string
L : GrayScale(1ch)
LA : GrayScale + Alpha (2ch)
BG, BR, GR (2ch)
BGR(3ch)
BGRA(4ch)

member.name: P:ViDi2.IToolParameters.LowPrecision
member.summary:
Get or sets whether the tool use low-precision mode.
If your system meets certain specific requirements (CUDA Compute Capability 6.1 or greater),
You can enable the Low Precision processing mode for Red Analyze and Green Classify tools.
(Warning) Once set to true, the parameter cannot be reverted

member.name: P:ViDi2.IToolParameters.SupportsLowPrecision
member.summary: Returns true if the tool supports low-precision mode

member.name: P:ViDi2.IToolParameters.TrainingMode
member.summary:
Returns the training mode in Red-Tool(Focused Mode)
"unsupervised" or "supervised"

member.name: T:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters
member.summary: Represents the tool-parameters for the runtime blue tool

member.name: P:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters.Threshold
member.summary:
Gets or sets the detection threshold
Threshold determines how closely the found feature must be to the desired feature in order for it to be considered detected.
The found feature must exceed the setting.
(Between 0 ~ 1)

member.name: P:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters.Precision
member.summary:
Gets or sets the localization precision in % of the feature-size
(Between 0 ~ 1)
[Example]
if Feature Size is 40, and Precision setting is 5%,
the tool will stop searching for the position of the feature
when the next jump would be less than 2 pixels(0.05 * 40 = 2 pixels).

member.name: P:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters.OrientedFeatures
member.summary:
Gets whether the features are oriented
In other words, whether the rotation detection of feature is allowed.

member.name: P:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters.ScaledFeatures
member.summary:
Gets whether the features are scaled
In other words, whether detection of various sizes is allowed for each feature.

member.name: P:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters.NonUniformlyScaledFeatures
member.summary:
Gets whether the features are scaled non-uniformly
In other words, whether detection of various sizes is allowed for each feature.(Not fixed aspect ratio)

member.name: P:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters.AngleRange
member.summary:
Gets or sets the range of angles at which features are searched
Returns radian value
Multiply by 180/PI to get degree value() like the below example.
[Example]
If AngleRange.Lower value = 1.57079632...
AngleRange.Lower * (180/Math.PI) => 90 ()

member.name: P:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters.SizeRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of scales at which features are searched

member.name: P:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters.AspectRatioRange
member.summary:
Gets or sets the range of aspect-ratios at which features are searched
Default value is 100

member.name: P:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters.FeatureFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the feature filter

member.summary:
Whether the training UI should show or hide the information rectangles about feature ID and match state
True : Show Feature Names
False : Hide Feature Names

member.name: P:ViDi2.IBlueToolParameters.ShowRectangularFeatures
member.summary:
Whether the training UI should show rectangular feature graphics or elliptical
True : Show Rectangular Feature Graphic
False : Show Round Feature Graphic
